--------------------
Text: The Olympian and its successor the Olympian Hiawatha were passenger trains operated by the Chicago, Milwaukee, St. Paul and Pacific Railroad (the "Milwaukee Road") between Chicago and the Pacific Northwest.
Triplets:<The Olympian
Chicago, Milwaukee, St. Paul and Pacific Railroad
2:
--------------------
Text: Olympian Hiawatha:  The streamlined "Olympian Hiawatha" operated from 1947 to 1961 and was one of several Milwaukee Road trains to carry the name "Hiawatha."
Triplets:<Olympian Hiawatha
3:
--------------------
<Text: Olympian Hiawatha:  The "Olympian Hiawatha" was designed by industrial designer Brooks Stevens and included the distinctive glassed-in "Skytop" observation-sleeping cars.>
Triplets:<Olympian Hiawatha
